![Gamami Beach (가마미해수욕장)](/2023-01-19-1674103234512/189654_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Located 24 kilometers west of Yeonggwang-eup, Gamami Beach was first opened in 1925. The beach is 1 kilometer in length and 200 meters in x_width, and has the shape of a half moon. Around 200 pine trees encompass the area and form a dense cozy forest. The water is only about 1 to 2 meters deep and its clear waters make it one of the three best beaches in the southwestern part of Korea.
Small islands dot the sea in front of the beach and the view of the fishing boats drifting by is very peaceful. The sunset on the west gives off a different vibe from the sunrise of the east. Near the beach area is a coastal drive way with a wonderful view of the coast. Dombaeseom Island, famous for ocean fishing, and Chilsando Island are lined up more or less in a row. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|• 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
• For more info: +82-61-356-1020| |parking:|Available| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Available Facilities:|Pavilion, shower booths, camping site, water fountain, accommodations, restaurants, etc. | |Restrooms:|Available| ## Detail Image ![/2023-01-19-1674103234512/189660_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-19-1674103234512/189660_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-19-1674103234512/583932_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-19-1674103234512/583932_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-19-1674103234512/583933_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-19-1674103234512/583933_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-19-1674103234512/583994_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-19-1674103234512/583994_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-19-1674103234512/635717_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-19-1674103234512/635717_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-19-1674103234512/635723_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-19-1674103234512/635723_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-19-1674103234512/635727_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-19-1674103234512/635727_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-19-1674103234512/635732_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-19-1674103234512/635732_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-19-1674103234512/635742_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-19-1674103234512/635742_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-19-1674103234512/583995_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-19-1674103234512/583995_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [☎️+82-61-356-1020](tel:+82613561020) - [🏠yeonggwang.go.kr](http://tour.yeonggwang.go.kr) ```googleMap latitude: 35.3997293920 longitude: 126.4090769892 title: 355, Gamami-ro, Yeonggwang-gun, Jeollanam-do ```

data.title: Gamami Beach (가마미해수욕장)
data.description:
Located 24 kilometers west of Yeonggwang-eup, Gamami Beach was first opened in 1925. The beach is 1 kilometer in length and 200 meters in x_width, and has the shape of a half moon. Around 200 pine trees encompass the area and form a dense cozy forest. The water is only about 1 to 2 meters deep and its clear waters make it one of the three best beaches in the southwestern part of Korea.
Small islands dot the sea in front of the beach and the view of the fishing boats drifting by is very peaceful. The sunset on the west gives off a different vibe from the sunrise of the east. Near the beach area is a coastal drive way with a wonderful view of the coast. Dombaeseom Island, famous for ocean fishing, and Chilsando Island are lined up more or less in a row.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Tamjin River Wetland Eco-Park (탐진강 생태습지원)
dataList.description: The Tamjin River Wetland Eco-Park opened in July 2008 to preserve the pristine nature of Tamjin River and to maintain a better waterfront. It is a widely spread natural river wetland eco-park that covers 13.130㎡ along the waterside of Tamjin River, which holds superior-grade water that flows mainly through the Jangheung area from Pyeonghwa Bridge in Jangheung-eup to Busan Bridge. Within the park, there are acupressure paths, wooden decks, trails for observing aquatic plants and eco-life, walking trails and a fountain.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Taepyung Salt Farm (태평염전)
dataList.description: Taepyung Salt Farm, located in Jeungdo-myeon, Jeollanam-do, is the largest sun-dried salt producer in Korea. Recently, a wooden trail has been installed around the farm. The farm takes pride in producing high quality natural salt full of minerals from pristine seawater.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Taepyeong Yeomsaeng Botanical Garden (태평염생식물원)
dataList.description:
Designated as a biodiversity conservation area by the UNESCO, Jeungdo Island in Sinan-gun, Jeollanam-do has become popular. Taepyeong Yeomsaeng Botanical Garden is located next to one of the largest solar-evaporation salt fields, and spans over an area of 110,000 ㎡. Over 70 species of various salt plant colonies grow at the natural mud flat including glasswort, sea-blite, East Asian seepweed, and Herbaceous seepweed to create a splendid scene. Also, one can easily see Tti (a plant) which can not grow in polluted places.

Walking along the 220 meter-long walking path, diverse mud flat creatures like mudskippers, crabs, and gastropods can be seen up close.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Taeansa Temple (태안사)
dataList.description: Located on the foot of Dongnisan Mountain, Taeansa Temple was built by three monks during the reign of the Silla King, Gyeongdeok (742). Afterwards, Monk Hyecheol constructed a large temple with 132 rooms during Goryeo Taejo’s reign, which was established as a central seminary of the Dongnisan Mountain area. In the precincts there are four treasures, including Hyecheolguksa Sari Pagoda, Gwangjaseonsa Pagoda and Neungpagak. The temple was badly damaged during the Korean War and had been refurbished since then. An invigorating valley and a shady nook can be reached just 1.8 kilometers from the entrance of the temple. It is a popular trail during the fall, with its bright maple leaves.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Suncheonman Bay Yongsan Observatory (순천만 용산전망대 (S자 물길))
dataList.description: Yongsan Observatory offers an unobstructed view of Suncheonman Bays large S-shaped waterway. The observatory can be reached by following the trail through the field of reeds, crossing over Daedae Estuary on Mujingyo Bridge. With a birds-eye-view, take in the vast fields of reeds and mudflats, dotted throughout with groups of birds wading through in search of food.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Suncheonman Bay Wetland Reserve (순천만습지 (구, 순천만자연생태공원))
dataList.description: Suncheonman Bays reed field covers a total area of approximately 495,867 ㎡, encompassing the regions of Gyoryang-dong and Daedae-dong in Suncheon as well as Haeryong-myeons Jungheung-ri, Haechang-ri, and Seonhak-ri. The reed field starts from the confluence of Dongcheon and Isacheon Streams, and stretches along both sides of the stream for approximately 3 kilometers until it reaches the main reed colony at Suncheonman Bay. The reed fields in Suncheonman Bay are thickly covered with reeds taller than a full-grown man. It is the biggest colony of reeds in Korea. The scene of the entire field swaying in the wind is like watching waves on the sea. Suncheonman Bay Wetland Reserve is a natural habitat for birds of over 140 species, including migratory and endangered bird species such as the hooded crane, white-naped crane, Oriental White Stork, black-faced spoonbill, Eurasian Oystercatcher as well as birds designated as natural treasures.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Suncheon Wild Tea House (순천전통야생차체험관)
dataList.description: Suncheon Wild Tea house is a tea experience house. It is located on the road to Seonamsa Temple in Jogyesan Mountain. At the Suncheon Wild Tea House, visitors can experience the beauty and the composure of a traditional Korean style house while enjoying the delicate flavor and scent of tea surrounded by scent of pine trees. Available programs are darye (manners of tea drinking) experience, tea making, tea cookie tasting and education on tea ceremony.
dataList.author: korea-tour
